13.text: But tonight we're looking for Impala.

56.text:
So far the Benjamin Bulldogs .357 has
impressed the guys here at Team Wild

61.text:
and experienced big game hunting Gavin
Ingram of Nduna Hunting Safaris.

66.text:
The all new Big Bore hunting air rifle
from Crosman

69.text:
has certainly lived up to the hype and

76.text:
However, hunting big game with an air
rifle isn't easy.

83.text:
range is a critical factor when hunting big
game with a air gun, the Bulldog certainly

89.text:
but the nozzle designed bullet doesn't
carry the same energy as semi

95.text: this means I've really got to get close

97.text: and into a good position, close enough for the Bulldog nozzle combo to do the business.

103.text: And as the game gets bigger

105.text:
needs to be perfect, you simply can't
afford to pull a shot

or miss the vitals on bigger game when

This is the challenge of big game air gun
hunting

117.text: and I'm loving every minute of it.

128.text: It's a windy morning in the hills of Nduna,

130.text:
and the hunting here today could bring
in additional challenge

134.text:
when the wind is up the animals become
nervous

139.text: Ordinary they use there acute sense of hearing and smell to detect

143.text:
However, when the wind is noisily
swirling through the trees

147.text:
senses are less affected. In conditions
like this

155.text:
we've not been out long when Gavin spot
something.

160.text: Gavin can see movement through the bushveld,

162.text: but getting into position may not be easy.

170.text: We head up and over the top using the tree line as cover.

175.text:
Despite the wind blowing it's still a
beautiful day.

179.text: However the game remains in thicker cover

184.text: We spot a group of red hartebeest

186.text: as they make a break for the top of the hill,

190.text:
but we're too far out for a shot and there's
very little cover between them and us.

211.text: An unsettled herd of red hartebeest can spook any animals in the vicinity,

215.text: so we decided to head on.

221.text:
into the bottom. There's less
interference from the wind down here

224.text: and the animals will hopefully be at ease.

228.text:
crisscross the entire state an offer the
game safe passage for one plane

258.text: As we merge onto the bottom,

259.text:
Gavin has spotted a herd of Impala
feeding just over the browl of this hill.

266.text:
there's very little cover again
between us them.

271.text:
We're 100 yards out and have no way of
getting closer from here.

276.text: We hit the deck crawl around them.

281.text:
There's a tree line to the right of the herd and
we should have just enough covered

307.text:
The herd are now on high alert and don't
look happy.

314.text: I get a good ram in my crossheirs, but

318.text: before I can take my shot the herd make a run for it.

326.text:
After a frustrating morning in the high
winds and then over

329.text:
an hour calling into position, 70 yards
out from the Impala

336.text: But we've been too eager and moved in too quickly.

340.text: Our lack of patience has cost us and the herd has made a run for it.

354.text:
This is the challenge a Big Bore
airgun hunting.

358.text: You're stalking must be perfect so that you can get into

360.text:
a good position and then your shot
placement most also be spot-on

366.text: Airgun hunting is much less forgiving then with a full bore rifle,

374.text:
but we will be back out in the bushveld
again tomorrow.
